pr_title: Refactor DI code; add @Named support for constructor injection; Change PackageStore to use it.

timeline.message: WIP; Add @Named support for constructor injection

timeline.bodyText: I wouldn't change this name since it mirrors the Map interface.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText:
Well. The thing is I thought it mirrors the Map interface and then I got totally confused. The mapping function is from a Value<T> to a T, instead of key to value . This is super confusing. That's why I added computeObject, because it is not computing Value as the Map interface.
Also I checked the only usage for this mapping function in the locate, is not really to "map". We just used the "Key" here as a way to to access Value<T> in the lambda function, which is also confusing.
My plan is to discuss about and improve the locate together as separating the EG service logic from DI, as discussed below.
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText: Why revisit? Can you explain more in your comment about what you don't like or what needs to be changed?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText:
Good suggestion. I did have many thoughts when I wrote this TODO, so I should capture those.
For this method, I basically didn't look into it in this PR. Need to do the same for single-letter vars and possible re-structuring.
Another big thing to revisit is that I really feel we should remove/move out some special business logic for EvergreenService in the Context, for example addOrUpdateDependency.
My early feeling is that Context.java should handle the general DI (don't get me wrong, it will be aware of EvergreenService type), but the specific EG business logic like addOrUpdateDependency, and even methods specifically for locate, should be separated out so that it's more independent and therefore maintainable. I remember you once spent some effort fixing a EG service dependency initialization bug so hopefully when we need to deal with it next time, we don't need to go through the entire DI's code.
I really want to get your and team's thoughts after we have more readable DI code, after this PR gets merged in. That's why I left the TODO.
